page.title: 16HOLME LACY -PEOPLE'S LIVES 2
page.content: Although they generally liked the village, there were a number of things people would like changed, mostly to do with{transport. }There is{only one {bus into the village}- on Wednesdays - {and one out}- on Saturdays - giving travel straight to and from Hereford, and they would definitely like more buses. They also miss{"their" {railway}line, as it provided quick, {cheap transport to and from the city. There are now{many more lorries}than there used to be, and the people don't like them going through the village. A lot didn't like Mr Wilcox's works, mostly because of the{huge crane}in his yard, which is not pretty in a small village. Some of the villagers have{trouble with}their{neighbours dumping rubbish on their land, but most of them are reasonably happy. None asked for{shops or a pub.
